teams.name: Alpine
teams.description: Alpine may be a relatively new name to Formula 1, but Renault's famous sports car brand has a lot of motorsport heritage. The team's 2021 rebrand marked the next step in Renault's F1 renaissance, which began in 2016 with the acquisition of the then Lotus team. Already race winners with their new version, regular podium finishes and a title aspiration should be their next target.
teams.homeRace: French Grand Prix - Circuit Paul Ricard

teams.name: Aston Martin
teams.fullName: Aston Martin Aramco Formula One Team
teams.description: Aston Martin's original incursion into Formula 1, more than half a century ago, lasted only five races. This time, however, it's serious. This F1 team is no stranger to success, having won with its original Jordan version and, more recently, as Racing Point in 2020. Recognized for its ability to punch above its weight, and now with a two-time champion leading its driver lineup, and the most famous F1 designer to join in 2025, Aston Martin is largely a team to follow.

teams.name: Ferrari
teams.description: For many, the races of Ferrari and Formula 1 have become inseparable. The Cavallino Rampante, the only team to have competed in all seasons since the start of the world championship, has grown from Enzo Ferrari's humble dream to becoming one of the most iconic and recognized brands in the world. Success came quickly through players like Alberto Ascari and John Surtees, and continued, in lean times, with Niki Lauda in the 1970s and then with Michael Schumacher in the 2000s, when Ferrari claimed five consecutive titles without precedent, securing its status as the most successful and decorated team in the history of F1.
teams.homeRace: Grand Premio D'Italia - Autodromo Nazionale Monza

teams.name: Haas
teams.description: Haas, the youngest team on the grid, made its impressive debut in 2016 and, in the process, became the first F1 team led by Americans in three decades. Founded by industrialist Gene Haas, they have their headquarters in the United States in the same facilities as their winning NASCAR Sprint Cup Series team, Stewart-Haas Racing. The Ferrari-powered team also has a factory in the United Kingdom in Banbury.
teams.homeRace: United States Grand Prix - Circuit of The Americas

teams.name: Kick Sauber
teams.description: After enjoying considerable success in the world of motorsport, where he helped nurture the emerging stars of F1 Michael Schumacher and Heinz-Harald Frentzen, Peter Sauber guided his namesake team to Formula 1 in 1993. Since then, the team has established itself as a pillar of the grid, becoming race winners under the brief ownership of BMW, and developing a well-earned reputation not only for producing competitive cars, but also for developing young drivers. In recent seasons, they ran under the name Alfa Romeo, and in 2026 they will become the official Audi team, but since 2024 a new main sponsor has brought a new identity to the famous Swiss team.

teams.name: McLaren
teams.description: Since entering the sport in 1966 under the guidance and relentless effort of its founder, Bruce, McLaren's success has been nothing short of impressive. Five decades of brilliance have produced countless victories, pole positions and podiums, not to mention nine constructor championships. Additionally, some of the best drivers in this sport made a name for themselves at the team, like Emerson Fittipaldi, Ayrton Senna, Mika Hakkinen and Lewis Hamilton.

teams.name: Mercedes
teams.description: The modern renaissance of Mercedes in Formula 1 began with the creation of an official team for 2010, the platform for meteoric ascension in the order of the Grand Prix. The team generated a great deal of emotion from the beginning with the sensational return of Michael Schumacher, but the headlines soon followed on the track: three podiums in their debut season, all through Nico Rosberg, who then achieved a double pole / victory in China in 2012. The following season was paired with Lewis Hamilton, the duo went on to have some epic battles for the title when the Silver Arrows barrier everything in front of them to become one of the most dominant forces of the modern era of F1, until Red Bull arrived and stole that crown. However, with the race winner George Russell now associated with the rising star Kimi Antonelli, Mercedes is still one of the teams to beat.

teams.name: Racing Bulls
teams.fullName: Visa Cash App Racing Bulls Formula One Team
teams.description: Established in 2006 as a team in which the young drivers of the prodigious talent group of Red Bull could be trained in Formula 1, Racing Bulls, originally called Toro Rosso, then AlphaTauri and then RB, was formed from the ashes of the brave Minardi team. Sebastian Vettel gave immediate validity to the approach, achieving a fairy-tale victory in 2008, before passing to enjoy success in the world championship with the Red Bull Racing team. Today, the spirit of fostering talent is still valid, although the Italian team is no longer simply a B team, but a constructor by right.
teams.homeRace: Grand Premio D'Italia - Autodromo Nazionale Monza

teams.name: Red Bull
teams.description: Red Bull was no stranger to Formula 1, as sponsors, before formally entering as an official team in 2004. Nevertheless, the scale of its success during the following decade was astonishing. After a first podium in 2006, the team reached its stride in 2009, achieving six victories and second place in the constructor standings. During the following four seasons they were a tour de force, claiming consecutive double titles between 2010 and 2013, with Sebastian Vettel emerging as the youngest quadruple champion of the sport. Now they are recapturing that glory with an equally exciting talent: one called Max Verstappen.
teams.homeRace: Austrian Grand Prix - Red Bull Ring

teams.name: Williams
teams.description: Driven by the brilliance and passion of the late Sir Frank Williams, Williams grew from humble beginnings to become a giant of Formula 1, without rival for all, except Ferrari and McLaren, in terms of lasting success. Over the last four decades, the team has accumulated victories in Grand Prix and glory in the championship, and in the process has nurtured some of the greatest talents of the sport, both inside and outside the cockpit. And, after the Williams family's decision to take a step back after selling the team in 2020 to Dorilton Capital, a new era has begun.
